books.title: Funeral Oration on Meletius
books.description: Saint Meletius was Patriarch of Antioch from 360 until his death in 381. One of his last acts was to preside over the First Council of Constantinople in 381. Saint Gregory of Nyssa, his brother, Saint Basil the Great, and Saint Gregory Nazianzus were known as the Cappadocian Fathers. Saint Gregory was in attendance at the First Council of Constantinople, during which Meletius reposed, and gave the eulogy at the latter's funeral. - Summary by The Reader
